I'd rather make it a motion based attack that activates if you directly charge an entity. As the right click functionality from swords was removed so that players would use them in sync with shields.

Also I'd rather have this be a high knockback attack than a high damage one. It would make fighting mobs such as creepers and wither skeletons just a big easier.

Maybe it could be around 20% more, or 95% with critical strikes (added to the 50% extra damage).

I would really like this old feature back, now swimming takes longer to get across rivers and creeks. I know how this was called a bug. Because some stupid idiot head reported a very useful feature as a bug and Mojang removed the feature and put it as a bug fix on their page, but it's not actually a bug. Please Mojang, change the swimming on surface of water back!

Okay, I'm just gonna say that there are probably a few other such threads, and that you should probably take your ideas over there, so as to not clog up the primary idea pages.

I think that there is a reason they are not doing this. I mean, I feel like it is a little boring, similar to how developers decided against lava boats and went with striders. So, I am introducing the ELYTRA 3000 **Moog City plays in background**: this type of elytra has a mind of its own. It detects projectiles and will fold in to take the impact; somewhat unsafe while airborne, (not to mention the swirling around will make you a wee bit green) but offers better protection than an iron chestplate on the ground.
This is a FANTASTIC IDEA!!!

(Im on my alt rn my main is Monitizes) I believe you should have to report someone for them to be banned and Minecraft specifically says that you can mod the game and they change the rule after I mod so if I was banned for modding then its stupid because I modded before the rule in SINGLE PLAYER. But the ban system is most likely glitched as the most innocent people have been banned. I think all bans made before you perhaps implement the report button should be revoked...
The worst part is Minecraft is doing NOTHING about it and just does it's usual stuff. Minecraft was on drugs when making this addition

The potion to resist vampirism would stop you turning into a vampire. So you would drink before fighting vampires.

I kinda was iffy about turning into a bat. So maybe it could only last 2 minutes and recharges for 5 minutes. Maybe it's a poor man's Elytra. This one could go, because the rest is interesting enough.

What I was thinking about was balance, so that getting this effect could be useful but have some disadvantages.

Vampires (including the player with vampirism) should burn in daylight and have these status effects in the nighttime: 

  • Speed 2
  • Jump Boost 2
  • Resistance 3

Also, they should be avoided by: 

  • Villagers
  • Cats
  • Ocelots

They should also be attacked by wolves.

Vampires

The vampire resistance potion is brewn with garlic.

The status effect should be reversible IMO using a potion, different from Vampire Resistance Potion, which would be used for preventive purposes. The cure for Vampirism should be more expensive than V.R.P. and induce some secondary effects to the player for a limited amount of time (by example, while the potion is doing its work, like when curing zombie villagers and they shake).
I really like the idea. It would give Minecraft more of a eerie effect, but I would agree that it would be to intense to turn into a bat. Good thinking

It should be able to get hot and cold like in real life and that determine What weather you will get
Great idea in Creative mode please!!

I like storms and interesting weather events and I always imagine what my creative city would be like in a storm. I think Minecraft would be pretty cool with upgraded weather; Even just simply adding a more interesting rain animation like occasional wind gusts pushing the rain a direction / more intense animations for storms would be pretty cool. Another suggestion would be fog which can make survival more fun and challenging. Windy days can make it harder for the player to move a direction and wind gusts can push you off a cliff and spread fire faster. And what would be really cool is seeing that scary line of dark clouds slowly approaching as a storm creeps toward your village. (another use for the bell: severe thunderstorm warnings). Also, maybe make fire a little more resistant to rain so lightning strikes actually do some damage OR have lightning strikes happen before it starts raining or strike around nearby storms! Maybe you could even add flooding; Maybe from actual water sources being formed, or a separate type of water that forms beneath rain after a while of rain and makes it harder to move and damages torches and wool. Strong winds can damage banners and make it super dangerous to use an Elytra such as flinging you around into trees and mountains and greatly decreasing its durability. Tornados can be the only wind-type weather hazard that destroys full blocks and lifts entities off of the ground, fling them around (if you want to go that far which would be cool.)
I think it should be a miserable amount though. Almost nothing, but a reward none the less

This enchantment will make it easy to kill enderman also as they'll freeze as soon as they're hit. Or they can drop an item which can be brewed into a potion to get that effect.

To implement this into vanilla would also be cool, but so do hope if implemented in vanilla it would be done alongside other world scenarios I.e. drought where water blocks slowly disappear over time, ability to choose what dimension to spawn in, and the custom dimensions which have been discussed. I wouldn‚Äôt want to see these features replace standard vanilla world mechanics.

Monster spawners look good for decoration now that changes were made to snapshot 22w44a. I propose that monster spawners can be mined but in survival obviously no mobs can be put inside them.

This is the best solution for AFK fishing farms I've ever seen, because it greatly discourages them, rather than trying to break them outright, and at the same time encourages classic, properly-done fishing. I wish I could give this a good 10 upvotes.

I totally agree.

My idea for fishing would be more extreme, involving actual fish mobs being required to be caught. However, this alternative means of fishing would be fine if it were implemented. I've always disliked how exploitable the fishing mechanic is, so this new restriction would balance it out and encourage people to go find or make a body of water instead of sitting in their small contraptions.

Although despite that, there would still be a way to make an AFK fishing farm through connection to a larger body of water, so I do not know if it would make that much of a difference, however it certainly would be more challenging to make such.

But you can contribute to translating Oschdallgaierisch on the official Minecraft translation project on Crowdin.
